bibl.title: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1940

div1.p: Brewer has sent Hench copies of the Washington and Jefferson College program and will send photographs, a film, and souvenir cake plates as soon as possible.

div1.head: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 2, 1940

div1.p:
I am forwarding you today about forty copies
of the Founders' Day dinner program. There have
been so many requests here for the programs that
my supply is being depleted rapidly. I hope that
this number will be sufficient for your needs for
the present. If I am able to locate some more in
the future, I shall be glad to send them on to you.

At your request I am ordering copies of
the pictures which were taken last week and will
forward the movies to you just as soon as they are
returned to us.

Needless to say, the College got reams of
publicity from our Founders' Day program and a
great deal of it was due to your fine discoveries
about Jesse Lazear.

In a few days we hope to be able to forward
you the remaining souvenir cake plates which you
ordered. We have had some difficulty in getting
them from the manufacturer.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Melvin D. Brewer
Alumni Secretary Dr. Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
